name: The Palace at One & Only Royal Mirage Dubai

reviews.title: 12th Time & Never Tire
reviews.text: We were one of the first guests to stay here, when it was under Sun International ownership.

reviews.title: Great Hotel, lots on construction but its everywhere in dubai
reviews.text: We can say that this is one of the best hotels we have stayed in. You would have trouble finding a better hotel.

We have just returned from a 4 day stay at the Palace at the One and Ony Royal Mirage in Dubai. What an amazing experience.... I almost cried when it was time to leave! The hotel is one of the most beautiful I've ever stayed in. The Arabic architecture, interiors, and landscaping made you feel like you were in a totally unique place. We forgot the outside world entirely and enjoyed the beauty and tranquility of the place. The pool was the absolute best pool we've ever been in. The ''floating'' palm trees meant that the dabbled sunlight came through without inflicting too much severe sunlight. There were lots of little nooks and cranies in the pool, so you had space to have your privacy. The restaurants were the absolute best. Based on advice from this website, we booked ahead, so reservations were no problem. We loved our dinner at Ninas, where we enjoyed one of the best Indian meals we've ever had (and we've lived in India for 6 years!). However, nothing compared to the incredible meal we had at Tangines! The food, the service, the atmosphere were all top-notch, and all made for an evening we'll remember for the rest of our lives. The staff throughout the hotel couldn't have been more gracious, and everyone remembered our names and room numbers. We'll be back, for sure!

reviews.title: Class...

reviews.text: Have just returned from a very short stay at the Palace, Royal Mirage, and just had to write to say how fantastic it was. Everything, from the moment you arrive, is superb. The staff are extremely helpful and polite and, as the previous reviews have stated, the pool staff are amazing. We ate at the Beach Bar a couple of times and each time were not disappointed. We also dined at Olives which was excellent value for money. I would definately recommed this hotel if you are looking for, intimacy, pure indulgence in romantic surroundings - cant wait to return.
reviews.title: Absolute bliss
Fantastic!!
reviews.text: P.S. We were hoping to book the JUMERIAH BEACH HOTEL initially but it was fully booked. Having paid a visit, I have to say that we were really glad to have got into the Palace and it was around £200 cheaper!!

reviews.title: Go on - spoil yourself!
reviews.text: What can I say ...had 5 amazing nights at the Royal Mirage - The Palace. On arrival you felt very special, we did have to wait an hour and a half for our room to be ready however this was fine as we had breakfast and wondered round the hotel having a look.

reviews.title: Simply the Best !!
reviews.text: Building work - not a problem you can hear a slight buzzing in the back round but thats about it. On the beach to your right hand side you can see in the far distance lorries driving back and forth but you barely notice it. Straight ahead of you is Palm Island you can see it but its not ugly view it just looks like an island not a building site. To the side of you 2 buildings are being worked on but it no way spoils the setting and again noise is barely there!
They treat you like Kings, they will do anything for you.
reviews.title: Just got back from best holiday ever !!!!

aka: The Palace At One&Only Royal Mirage Dubai Hotel
description: The Palace at One&Only Royal Mirage conjures the magic of Arabia, a domain where guests may wander amidst the abundant gardens or stroll amongst the meandering water features. The property is generous, with 231 guest rooms and suites, on a private beach that offers rich leisure facilities, such as the impressive temperature-controlled swimming pools, water sports centre, tennis courts, golf putting green, ‘KidsOnly’ children’s facilities and, most importantly, a tranquil haven for rest and relaxation.
